title: Business & Finance
text:
FTX's collapse likely exposed the cryptocurrency exchange and its founder to potential criminal liability, according to attorneys who specialize in white-collar criminal law.

---

Japan's economy contracted for the first time in a year in the third quarter, shrinking 0.3% from the previous quarter and 1.2% on an annualized basis.

---

The Fed's Brainard said the central bank is likely to slow its pace of raising interest rates at its meeting next month.

---

Berkshire spent roughly $9 billion on the stock market in the third quarter amid heightened price volatility, filings show.

---

U.S. stocks fell, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow retreating 0.9%, 1.1% and 0.6%, respectively.

---

Estee Lauder is nearing a deal to buy Tom Ford for roughly $2.8 billion, building on a longstanding licensing deal and marking its largest-ever acquisition.

---

Google agreed to pay $391.5 million to settle allegations that it persistently misled consumers about how it tracked them on devices.

---

A legal battle between Apple and "Fortnite" maker Epic over how apps are distributed on the iPhone took its next steps in court.
